underlying_goal: To analyze and standardize the project's caching patterns by researching existing implementations, comparing them against internal and external best practices, and updating documentation and fixing critical bugs.
friction_detail: MCP tools for fetching code from other repos were extremely slow and timed out, forcing a manual fallback to curl. The user also hit an API rate limit.
primary_success: Proactively identifying and comparing multiple reference implementations (latteries, safety-tooling, Inspect AI) to provide a comprehensive recommendation, and then identifying and fixing critical thread-safety bugs.
brief_summary: The user initiated a review of the project's caching mechanisms. Claude explored the existing code, compared it against internal reference implementations and best practices, and proposed updates to the documentation (CLAUDE.md). During the investigation, Claude identified and fixed several critical thread-safety race conditions in the caching code.
